Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.util

Class OtpTools

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.util.OtpTools
public final class OtpTools extends Object
Class for utility functions like OTP scrambling and formatting functions.
Since:
4.0

  • Method Details

    • scrambleOtp

      public static SecureString scrambleOtp(OtpTools.ScrambleType mode, SecureString otp)
      Compute a scrambled OTP from original OTP.
      Parameters:
      mode - - Specifies the mode of scrambling function
      otp - - Original otp. Length must greater or equal to 5 and only digits are accepted.
      Returns:
      The scrambled OTP
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When scramble type or otp is invalid

    • formatOtp

      public static SecureString formatOtp(OtpTools.FormatType mode, SecureString otp)
      Format the OTP with according provided mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - - Specifies the mode of formatting function
      otp - - original OTP if mode is see OtpTools.FormatType.CAP
      OTP length Formatted OTP
      1 X
      2 XX
      3 XXX
      4 XXXX
      5 XX XXX
      6 XXX XXX
      7 XXX XXXX
      8 XXXX XXXX
      9 XXX XXX XXX
      10 XX XXXX XXXX
      11 XXXXXXXXXXX
      12 XXXXXXXXXXXX
      >12 not changed
      Returns:
      The formatted OTP
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the otp or format type is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - when the mode is CAP and the otp contains a non-digit character.

    • padOtpWithZero

      public static SecureString padOtpWithZero(SecureString otp, int minLength)
      left pad an OTP with Zero if needed.
      Parameters:
      otp - OTP to pad.
      minLength - The minimum length of the padded OTP. If minLength is lower than the otp length, no padding is added and a copy of otp is returned (so original one can be wiped).
      Returns:
      The OTP value padded.
